result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Cantwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3.5 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: 21CF1900
Imposed and Stayed. Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment and or schooling. No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be monitored accordingly. Medication assisted treatment allowed. No contact K.P. without expressed written consent of agent. No contact with any known drug dealers or users with exception being programming. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A Cantwell

Invoice Atty Jamie McClendon

10:53 AM Defendant Michael A Cantwell in court, in custody.  Attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon and Ash Castro in court for Michael A Cantwell.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - 22CF922 Ct 1- GUILTY. 
21CF1900 Ct 1 without enhancers, Ct 2, Ct 3 without repeater- GUILTY. 
Factual basis found in complaint. 
BTC: 22CF922 GUILTY. 21CF1900 Cts 1, 2 & 3 GUILTY with remaining being dismissed and read in. 22CF933 will be dismissed and read in. 
State has nothing further to add. 
Defense give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 
22CF922-
3.5 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 18 months initial confinement with 2 years extended supervision imposed and stayed consecutive to 21CF1900. 
2 years of probation.  

Conditions of probation:
120 days STAYED.
No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be  monitored accordingly. 
Medication assisted treatment allowed. 
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and or schooling.
No contact with the K.P. without expressed written consent of agent. 
No contact with any known drug dealers or users with exception being programming. 
Firearm warning.
Voting warning.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge

Defendant is not eligible for CIP.
Defendant is eligible for SAP.  

21CF1900-
Ct 1-
3.5 years Wisconsin State Prison bifurcated 18 months initial confinement with 2 years extended supervision. 
Same conditions as outlined in 22CF922 with exception of conditional time. 

Ct 2-
30 days Racine County Jail concurrent. 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge

Ct 3-
6 months Racine County concurrent.  
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge

9:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael A Cantwell not in court, in custody. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant refused to appear.
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits based upon the refusal. Matter adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on July 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Not sufficient time

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No contact with the victim K.P(person, property, residence or family).

2:01 PM Prosecuting attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael A Cantwell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn appeared by video for Michael A Cantwell. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
